The Federalist Society seeks to educate the legal community through its programs and publications about how limited constitutional government based on the rule of law has positive effects on law and public policy.   Please visit our Facebook page . You may reach our board members by emailing nyu-federalist-society-group@nyu.edu . You may also sign up for our email list by logging into NYUHome, scrolling down to "Lists," and subcribing to the "fed-soc" list.       2015–2016 Executive Board   Faculty Advisor: Richard Epstein                                   Co-Presidents: Greg Arutiunov & Max Raskin                          Executive Vice President: Jack Millman     Vice President of Finance: Genna Sinel                               Vice President of Social Activities: Chris Porcelli                          Vice President of Speakers: Kyle Ezzedine                             Vice President of Event Planning: Eddie Guers                            Vice President of Communications: Sean Jameson                         Vice President of Alumni Relations: Tatiana Mejia Uribe                       Vice President of Membership Development: Paul-Gabriel Morales                   Vice President of Public Relations: Desiree Baca                         Liaison to the Journal of Law & Liberty: Michael Stachiw       Events   The event line-up for the 2015 – 2016 academic year will be posted in summer 2015. International Law Society | NYU School of Law                          Skip to main content                                     ›               Quicklinks       Areas of Study   Calendar   Career Services   Colloquia   Courses   Departments   Directories   Docket   Housing   Library   News and Press   NYU Home   Student Links   Technology                                              JD Admissions   Faculty & Scholarship   Global Opportunities   LLM/JSD Admissions   Academics & Courses   Law & Business   Executive Education   Current Students   Public Service   About NYU Law   Alumni & Giving   Centers & Institutes                               Home › Student Organizations › International Law Society             International Law Society                 International Law Society       ILS Board   Activities   Calendar of Events   Email Lists   Symposium                            New York University School of Law is the preeminent school in the country for the study of International Law. Many students choose to come to NYU because of this reputation and with the goal of involving themselves in international issues. The International Law Society (“ILS”) seeks to supplement the NYU global curriculum with numerous lectures, brown bag lunches, issue specific discussion groups, and career and academic panels. These are, of course, open to the entire school and will be frequented by upper-class students and LL.M.s as well as 1L students.   Additionally, ILS works to aid students in pursuing careers with an international dynamic. To that end, ILS organizes panel discussions in which they can learn about career and summer opportunities.   ILS also serves to better integrate NYU’s LL.M. students with the J.D. student body. This serves both a professional and social purpose. As the majority of LL.M. students have already practiced law in their home countries, they are well equipped to advise and provide help to those J.D. students who seek to work in international fields. J.D. students provide a perspective on the study and practice of law in the United States.   As in the past, ILS seeks to combine its resources with other groups and departments at the Law School for mutually beneficial activities. ILS hopes to take further advantage of contacts with Law Women, the Global Law School, the Environmental Law Society (“ELS”), the Office of Career Services (“OCS”), the Law Student Associations (the “-LSA”s), Law Students for Human Rights (“LSHR”), and other groups to provide more integrated and reaching discussions and opportunities.     Contact Us    International Law Society  Hanna Miller and Augustas Baliulis c/o NYU Law  40 Washington Square South  Room 110  New York, NY 10012  (212) 998-6575                           internationallawsocietynyu@ gmail.com                                                    Facebook   Twitter   YouTube   Instagram   Visitor Information   Directories   Offices and Departments   Site Map   NYU School of Law                   Prospective Info   Admissions (JD) Admissions (LLM/JSD) Areas of Study Degrees Offered Faculty Profiles Campus Map  Academics   Academic Sitemap Course Descriptions Class Schedules NYU Classes Clinics Academic Calendars  Departments   Academic Services Career Services Financial Aid Graduate Affairs (LLM) Hospitality and Events Housing Human Resources Library Operations and Facilities Records and Registration Student Affairs  Tools and Resources   About the Law School Campus Map Directories Law School News Journals Picture Book                      © 2015 New York University School of Law. 40 Washington Sq. Asia Law Society | NYU School of Law                          Skip to main content                                     ›               Quicklinks       Areas of Study   Calendar   Career Services   Colloquia   Courses   Departments   Directories   Docket   Housing   Library   News and Press   NYU Home   Student Links   Technology                                              JD Admissions   Faculty & Scholarship   Global Opportunities   LLM/JSD Admissions   Academics & Courses   Law & Business   Executive Education   Current Students   Public Service   About NYU Law   Alumni & Giving   Centers & Institutes                               Home › Student Organizations › Asia Law Society             Asia Law Society                 Asia Law Society       Delegation   Events   Forum   Asia Law at NYU   Links   Contact                           The Asia Law Society puts on panel discussions (including discussions on jobs in Asia, as well as political and legal scholarship), social gatherings (for LLMs and JDs with an interest in Asia and Asia-focused careers to meet), and Legal Mandarin classes. The highlight of the group is a trip we take every year, subsidized significantly, to an Asian city, to explore legal careers in Asia first-hand. We also communicate details of relevant events related to Asia and law that are happening at NYU or elsewhere in the city.   If you would like to participate in any of these events, then you are welcome to join our listserv. Please e-mail us at als.nyu@gmail.com to let us know of your interest.
